alert.note: Alert for Dubuque; Jackson (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 15 at 11:38AM CDT until July 15 at 4:30PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR NORTHEASTERN JACKSON, SOUTHEASTERN DUBUQUE, NORTHWESTERN CARROLL AND WESTERN JO DAVIESS COUNTIES... At 1138 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen, with a spotter report of 4.4 inches in Dubuque. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Dubuque, Galena, Asbury, Savanna, Bellevue, East Dubuque, Preston, Hanover, Elizabeth, Sabula, Miles, La Motte, Menominee, Rickardsville, Sherrill, Springbrook, St. Donatus, Sageville, Balltown and Durango. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
